entry.et: Middle English sterten; akin to Middle High German sterzen to stand up stiffly, move quickly

def.dt: :to move suddenly and violently :spring started angrily to his feet
:to react with a sudden brief involuntary movement started when a shot rang out
:to issue with sudden force blood starting from the wound
:to come into being, activity, or operation when does the movie start the rain started up again
:to protrude or seem to protrude eyes starting from their sockets
:to become loosened or forced out of place one of the planks has started
:to begin a course or journey started toward the door just starting out
:to range from a specified initial point the rates start at $10
:to begin an activity or undertaking
:to begin work
:to be a participant in a game or contest
:to be in the starting lineup
:to cause to leave a place of concealment :flush start a rabbit
:startle alarm
:to bring up for consideration or discussion
:to bring into being start a rumor
:to cause to become loosened or displaced
:to begin the use of start a fresh loaf of bread
:to cause to move, act, or operate start the motor
:to cause to enter a game or contest
:to put in the starting lineup
:to care for or train during the early stages of growth and development started plants a well-started coonhound
:to do or experience the first stages or actions of started studying music at the age of five
:to make trouble always trying to start something don't start anything
:at the beginning :initially
:in any event
:a sudden involuntary bodily movement or reaction woke with a start
:a brief and sudden action or movement
:a sudden capricious impulse or outburst
:a beginning of movement, activity, or development a false start housing starts
:head start
:a place of beginning
:the act or an instance of being a competitor in a race or a member of a starting lineup in a game undefeated in six starts Current Biography
strategic arms reduction talks
:the act or an instance of setting in operation or motion
:a fledgling business enterprise
:a premature start (as of a race or football play)
:an unsuccessful attempt to begin something (as a career)
:a start in racing in which the participants are already moving when they cross the starting line or receive the starting signal
:a favorable start of something
:an advantage granted or achieved at the beginning of a race, a chase, or a competition a 10-minute head start
:a favorable or promising beginning
:to start (an engine or vehicle) by temporary connection to an external power source (as another vehicle's battery)
:to start or restart rapidly or forcefully advertising can jump–start a political campaign
:to impart fresh or renewed energy to :energize a plan to jump–start the stagnant economy
:to start (as a motorcycle) by means of a kick-starter
:jump-start 2
:flying start
